description: Single and two storey side and rear extensions; alterations to roof to raise ridge height and rear dormer; external alterations
decision_conditions: <p class="MsoNormal">Before any development or construction work begins, a pre-commencement meeting shall be held on site between the appointed <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="arboricultural" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lvm9oym9i1co65qbi">arboricultural</span> consultant and site manager to discuss details of working procedures and agree that all tree protection measures have been installed in accordance with the tree protection plan. The site manager will be required to sign the awareness document (9.4 of John Cromar report) the details of which along with the evidence of the tree protection measures&nbsp;being installed and the agreed working procedures shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the local planning authority. The measures as so agreed shall be adhered to through the entire constructions period and the tree protection&nbsp;measures shall only be removed from site once all development is completed.&nbsp;<br></p>

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s), other than those shown on the approved plans shall be installed in the flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:&nbsp;P101; P201;&nbsp;<span style="line-height: 107%;">P202 Rev B;&nbsp;P301 Rev B;&nbsp;P302 Rev B;&nbsp;P401 Rev B;&nbsp;P402 Rev B; Arboricultural Report; Reasonable Exemption Statement</span>
The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
